definition: Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Mao
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor

sentences.english: However, Maugham is generally considered a realistic writer.
sentences.chinese: 但总的来看，毛姆是一个现实主义作家。

sentences.english: The collective effects of these reasons led Maugham to step on the land of China.
sentences.chinese: 正是这些原因的共同作用引领毛姆走上了中国大地。

sentences.english: Though I admire Maugham’s prose, I cannot agree with his view.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我非常欣赏毛姆，但是我并不同意他的观点。

sentences.english: Some days ago, I listened to the audiobook of Somerset Maugham’s autobiography The Summing Up.
sentences.chinese: 我记得以前，我听毛姆自传《总结》的音频书籍。

sentences.english: I have read the works of Maugham.
sentences.chinese: 我读过一些毛姆的作品。

sentences.english: The hair Mu big Shen quakes brain brush-off.

Stendhal
